abstract: An interactive map from the Census Bureau showing how political and economic forces have moved the center of the United States population from Kent County, Md. in 1790 to Plato, Mo., in 2010.
snippet: An interactive map from the Census Bureau showing how political and economic forces have moved the center of the United States population from Kent County, Md. in 1790 to Plato, Mo., in 2010.
lead_paragraph: 2:28 p.m. | Updated The Census Bureau has put together a neat interactive map showing the shifting center of the population, defined as “the place where an imaginary, flat, weightless and rigid map of the United States would balance perfectly if all residents were of identical weight.”
